text.en: Say: "I do not know whether that [doom] of which you were forewarned is near, or whether my Sustainer has set for it a distant term."
text.ar: قُلۡ إِنۡ أَدۡرِیۤ أَقَرِیبࣱ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمۡ یَجۡعَلُ لَهُۥ رَبِّیۤ أَمَدًا

text.en: He [alone] knows that which is beyond the reach of a created being's perception, and to none does He disclose aught of the mysteries of His Own unfathomable knowledge,
text.ar: عَـٰلِمُ ٱلۡغَیۡبِ فَلَا یُظۡهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَیۡبِهِۦۤ أَحَدًا

text.en: unless it be to an apostle whom He has been pleased to elect [there for]: and then He sends forth [the forces of heaven] to watch over him in whatever lies open before him and in what is beyond his ken –
text.ar: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱرۡتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولࣲ فَإِنَّهُۥ یَسۡلُكُ مِنۢ بَیۡنِ یَدَیۡهِ وَمِنۡ خَلۡفِهِۦ رَصَدࣰا

text.en: so as to make manifest that it is indeed [but] their Sustainer's messages that these [apostles] deliver: for it is He who encompasses [with His knowledge] all that they have [to say], just as He takes count, one by one, of everything [that exists].
text.ar: لِّیَعۡلَمَ أَن قَدۡ أَبۡلَغُوا۟ رِسَـٰلَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمۡ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَیۡهِمۡ وَأَحۡصَىٰ كُلَّ شَیۡءٍ عَدَدَۢا

text.en: O THOU enwrapped one!
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ یَـٰۤأَیُّهَا ٱلۡمُزَّمِّلُ

text.en: Keep awake [in prayer] at night, all but a small part
text.ar: قُمِ ٱلَّیۡلَ إِلَّا قَلِیلࣰا

text.en: of one-half thereof - or make it a little less than that,
text.ar: نِّصۡفَهُۥۤ أَوِ ٱنقُصۡ مِنۡهُ قَلِیلًا

text.en: or add to it [at will]; and [during that time] recite the Qur’an calmly and distinctly, with thy mind attuned to its meaning.
text.ar: أَوۡ زِدۡ عَلَیۡهِ وَرَتِّلِ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَرۡتِیلًا

text.en: Behold, We shall bestow upon thee a weighty message –
text.ar: إِنَّا سَنُلۡقِی عَلَیۡكَ قَوۡلࣰا ثَقِیلًا

text.en: [and,] verily, the hours of night the mind most strongly and speak with the clearest voice,
text.ar: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ ٱلَّیۡلِ هِیَ أَشَدُّ وَطۡـࣰٔا وَأَقۡوَمُ قِیلًا

text.en: whereas by day a long chain of doings is thy portion.
text.ar: إِنَّ لَكَ فِی ٱلنَّهَارِ سَبۡحࣰا طَوِیلࣰا

text.en: But [whether by night or by day,] remember thy Sustainer's name, and devote thyself unto Him with utter devotion.
text.ar: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلۡ إِلَیۡهِ تَبۡتِیلࣰا

text.en: The Sustainer of the east and the west [is He]: there is no deity save Him: hence, ascribe to Him alone the power to determine thy fate,
text.ar: رَّبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ لَاۤ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَٱتَّخِذۡهُ وَكِیلࣰا

text.en: and endure with patience whatever people may say [against thee], and avoid them with a comely avoidance.
text.ar: وَٱصۡبِرۡ عَلَىٰ مَا یَقُولُونَ وَٱهۡجُرۡهُمۡ هَجۡرࣰا جَمِیلࣰا

text.en: And leave Me alone [to deal] with those who give the lie to the truth - those who enjoy the blessings of life [without any thought of God] - and bear thou with them for a little while:
text.ar: وَذَرۡنِی وَٱلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ أُو۟لِی ٱلنَّعۡمَةِ وَمَهِّلۡهُمۡ قَلِیلًا

text.en: for, behold, heavy fetters [await them] with Us, and a blazing fire,
text.ar: إِنَّ لَدَیۡنَاۤ أَنكَالࣰا وَجَحِیمࣰا

text.en: and food that chokes, and grievous suffering
text.ar: وَطَعَامࣰا ذَا غُصَّةࣲ وَعَذَابًا أَلِیمࣰا

text.en: on the Day when the earth and the mountains will be convulsed and the mountains will [crumble and] become like a sand-dune on the move!
text.ar: یَوۡمَ تَرۡجُفُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَثِیبࣰا مَّهِیلًا

text.en: BEHOLD, [O men,] We have sent unto you an apostle who shall bear witness to the truth before you, even as We sent an apostle unto Pharaoh:
text.ar: إِنَّاۤ أَرۡسَلۡنَاۤ إِلَیۡكُمۡ رَسُولࣰا شَـٰهِدًا عَلَیۡكُمۡ كَمَاۤ أَرۡسَلۡنَاۤ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ رَسُولࣰا

text.en: and Pharaoh rebelled against the apostle, whereupon We took him to task with a crushing grip.
text.ar: فَعَصَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنُ ٱلرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذۡنَـٰهُ أَخۡذࣰا وَبِیلࣰا

text.en: How, then, if you refuse to acknowledge the truth, will you protect yourselves on that Day which shall turn the hair of children grey,
text.ar: فَكَیۡفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرۡتُمۡ یَوۡمࣰا یَجۡعَلُ ٱلۡوِلۡدَ ٰ⁠نَ شِیبًا

text.en: [the Day] on which the skies shall be rent asunder, [and] His promise [of resurrection] fulfilled?
text.ar: ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ مُنفَطِرُۢ بِهِۦۚ كَانَ وَعۡدُهُۥ مَفۡعُولًا

text.en: This, verily, is a reminder: let him who wills, then set out on a way to his Sustainer!
text.ar: إِنَّ هَـٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةࣱۖ فَمَن شَاۤءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِیلًا

text.en: BEHOLD, [O Prophet,] thy Sustainer knows that thou keepest awake [in prayer] nearly two-thirds of the night, or one-half of it, or a third of it, together with some of those who follow thee. And God who determines the measure of night and day, is aware that you would never grudge it: and therefore He turns towards you in His grace. Recite, then, as much of the Qur’an as you may do with ease. He knows that in time there will be among you sick people, and others who will go about the land in search of God's bounty, and others who will fight in God’s cause. Recite, then, [only] as much of it as you may do with ease, and be constant in prayer, and spend in charity, and [thus] lend unto God a goodly loan: for whatever good deed you may offer up in your own behalf, you shall truly find it with God - yea, better, and richer in reward. And [always] seek God's forgiveness: behold, God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!
text.ar: ۞ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ یَعۡلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدۡنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَیِ ٱلَّیۡلِ وَنِصۡفَهُۥ وَثُلُثَهُۥ وَطَاۤىِٕفَةࣱ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِینَ مَعَكَۚ وَٱللَّهُ یُقَدِّرُ ٱلَّیۡلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَۚ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحۡصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَیۡكُمۡۖ فَٱقۡرَءُوا۟ مَا تَیَسَّرَ مِنَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانِۚ عَلِمَ أَن سَیَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرۡضَىٰ وَءَاخَرُونَ یَضۡرِبُونَ فِی ٱلۡأَرۡضِ یَبۡتَغُونَ مِن فَضۡلِ ٱللَّهِ وَءَاخَرُونَ یُقَـٰتِلُونَ فِی سَبِیلِ ٱللَّهِۖ فَٱقۡرَءُوا۟ مَا تَیَسَّرَ مِنۡهُۚ وَأَقِیمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَقۡرِضُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنࣰاۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُوا۟ لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنۡ خَیۡرࣲ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَیۡرࣰا وَأَعۡظَمَ أَجۡرࣰاۚ وَٱسۡتَغۡفِرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورࣱ رَّحِیمُۢ

text.en: O THOU [in thy solitude] enfolded!
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ یَـٰۤأَیُّهَا ٱلۡمُدَّثِّرُ

text.en: Arise and warn!
text.ar: قُمۡ فَأَنذِرۡ

text.en: And thy Sustainer's greatness glorify!
text.ar: وَرَبَّكَ فَكَبِّرۡ

text.en: And thine inner self purify!
text.ar: وَثِیَابَكَ فَطَهِّرۡ

text.en: And all defilement shun!
text.ar: وَٱلرُّجۡزَ فَٱهۡجُرۡ

text.en: And do not through giving seek thyself to gain,
text.ar: وَلَا تَمۡنُن تَسۡتَكۡثِرُ

text.en: but unto thy Sustainer turn in patience.
text.ar: وَلِرَبِّكَ فَٱصۡبِرۡ

text.en: And [warn all men that] when the trumpet-call [of resurrection] is sounded,
text.ar: فَإِذَا نُقِرَ فِی ٱلنَّاقُورِ

text.en: that very Day shall be a day of anguish,
text.ar: فَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ یَوۡمٌ عَسِیرٌ

text.en: not of ease, for all who [now] deny the truth!
text.ar: عَلَى ٱلۡكَـٰفِرِینَ غَیۡرُ یَسِیرࣲ

text.en: LEAVE Me alone [to deal] with him whom I have created alone,
text.ar: ذَرۡنِی وَمَنۡ خَلَقۡتُ وَحِیدࣰا

text.en: and to whom I have granted resources vast,
text.ar: وَجَعَلۡتُ لَهُۥ مَالࣰا مَّمۡدُودࣰا

text.en: and children as [love's] witnesses,
text.ar: وَبَنِینَ شُهُودࣰا

text.en: and to whose life I gave so wide a scope:
text.ar: وَمَهَّدتُّ لَهُۥ تَمۡهِیدࣰا

text.en: and yet, he greedily desires that I give yet more!
text.ar: ثُمَّ یَطۡمَعُ أَنۡ أَزِیدَ

text.en: Nay, verily, it is against Our messages that he knowingly, stubbornly sets himself
text.ar: كَلَّاۤۖ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لِـَٔایَـٰتِنَا عَنِیدࣰا

text.en: [and so] I shall constrain him to endure a painful uphill climb!
text.ar: سَأُرۡهِقُهُۥ صَعُودًا

text.en: Behold, [when Our messages are conveyed to one who is bent on denying the truth,] he reflects and meditates [as to how to disprove them] –
text.ar: إِنَّهُۥ فَكَّرَ وَقَدَّرَ

text.en: and thus he destroys himself, the way he meditates:
text.ar: فَقُتِلَ كَیۡفَ قَدَّرَ

text.en: yea, he destroys himself, the way he meditates!
text.ar: ثُمَّ قُتِلَ كَیۡفَ قَدَّرَ

text.en: and then he looks [around for new arguments],
text.ar: ثُمَّ نَظَرَ

text.en: and then he frowns and glares,
text.ar: ثُمَّ عَبَسَ وَبَسَرَ

text.en: and in the end he turns his back [on Our message], and glories in his arrogance,
text.ar: ثُمَّ أَدۡبَرَ وَٱسۡتَكۡبَرَ

text.en: and says, "All this is mere spellbinding eloquence handed down [from olden times]!
text.ar: فَقَالَ إِنۡ هَـٰذَاۤ إِلَّا سِحۡرࣱ یُؤۡثَرُ

text.en: This is nothing but the word of mortal man!"
text.ar: إِنۡ هَـٰذَاۤ إِلَّا قَوۡلُ ٱلۡبَشَرِ

text.en: [Hence,] I shall cause him to endure hell-fire [in the life to come]!
text.ar: سَأُصۡلِیهِ سَقَرَ

text.en: And what could make thee conceive what hell-fire is?
text.ar: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا سَقَرُ

text.en: It does not allow to live, and neither leaves [to die],
text.ar: لَا تُبۡقِی وَلَا تَذَرُ

text.en: making [all truth] visible to mortal man.
text.ar: لَوَّاحَةࣱ لِّلۡبَشَرِ

text.en: Over it are nineteen [powers].
text.ar: عَلَیۡهَا تِسۡعَةَ عَشَرَ

text.en: For We have caused none but angelic powers to lord over the fire [of hell]; and We have not caused their number to be aught but a trial for those who are bent on denying the truth - to the end that they who have been granted revelation aforetime might be convinced [of the truth of this divine writ]; and that they who have attained to faith [in it] might grow yet more firm in their faith; and that [both] they who have been granted the earlier revelation and they who believe [in this one] might be freed of all doubt; and that they in whose hearts is disease and the who deny the truth outright might ask, "What does [your] God mean by this parable?" In this way God lets go astray him that wills [to go astray], and guides aright him that wills [to be guided]. And none can comprehend thy Sustainers forces save Him alone: and all this is but a reminder to mortal man.
text.ar: وَمَا جَعَلۡنَاۤ أَصۡحَـٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَـٰۤىِٕكَةࣰۖ وَمَا جَعَلۡنَا عِدَّتَهُمۡ إِلَّا فِتۡنَةࣰ لِّلَّذِینَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِیَسۡتَیۡقِنَ ٱلَّذِینَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلۡكِتَـٰبَ وَیَزۡدَادَ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوۤا۟ إِیمَـٰنࣰا وَلَا یَرۡتَابَ ٱلَّذِینَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلۡكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَ وَلِیَقُولَ ٱلَّذِینَ فِی قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضࣱ وَٱلۡكَـٰفِرُونَ مَاذَاۤ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَـٰذَا مَثَلࣰاۚ كَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ یُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن یَشَاۤءُ وَیَهۡدِی مَن یَشَاۤءُۚ وَمَا یَعۡلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَۚ وَمَا هِیَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرَىٰ لِلۡبَشَرِ

text.en: NAY, but consider the moon!
text.ar: كَلَّا وَٱلۡقَمَرِ

text.en: Consider the night when it departs,
text.ar: وَٱلَّیۡلِ إِذۡ أَدۡبَرَ

text.en: and the morn when it dawns!
text.ar: وَٱلصُّبۡحِ إِذَاۤ أَسۡفَرَ

text.en: Verily, that [hell-fire) is Indeed one of the great [forewarnings] –
text.ar: إِنَّهَا لَإِحۡدَى ٱلۡكُبَرِ

text.en: a warning to mortal man –
text.ar: نَذِیرࣰا لِّلۡبَشَرِ

text.en: to everyone of you, whether he chooses to come forward or to hang back!
text.ar: لِمَن شَاۤءَ مِنكُمۡ أَن یَتَقَدَّمَ أَوۡ یَتَأَخَّرَ

text.en: [On the Day of Judgment,] every human being will be held in pledge for whatever [evil] he has wrought –
text.ar: كُلُّ نَفۡسِۭ بِمَا كَسَبَتۡ رَهِینَةٌ

text.en: save those who shall have attained to righteousness:
text.ar: إِلَّاۤ أَصۡحَـٰبَ ٱلۡیَمِینِ

text.en: [dwelling] In gardens [of paradise], they will inquire
text.ar: فِی جَنَّـٰتࣲ یَتَسَاۤءَلُونَ

text.en: of those who were lost in sin:
text.ar: عَنِ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِینَ

text.en: "What has brought you into hell-fire?"
text.ar: مَا سَلَكَكُمۡ فِی سَقَرَ

text.en: They will answer: "We were not among those who prayed;
text.ar: قَالُوا۟ لَمۡ نَكُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُصَلِّینَ

text.en: and neither did we feed the needy;
text.ar: وَلَمۡ نَكُ نُطۡعِمُ ٱلۡمِسۡكِینَ

text.en: and we were wont to indulge in sinning together with all [the others] who indulged in it;
text.ar: وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ ٱلۡخَاۤىِٕضِینَ

text.en: and the Day of Judgment we were wont to call a lie –
text.ar: وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِیَوۡمِ ٱلدِّینِ

text.en: until certainty came upon us [in death]."
text.ar: حَتَّىٰۤ أَتَىٰنَا ٱلۡیَقِینُ

text.en: And so, of no benefit to them could be the intercession of any that would intercede for them.
text.ar: فَمَا تَنفَعُهُمۡ شَفَـٰعَةُ ٱلشَّـٰفِعِینَ

text.en: WHAT, THEN, is amiss with them that they turn away from all admonition
text.ar: فَمَا لَهُمۡ عَنِ ٱلتَّذۡكِرَةِ مُعۡرِضِینَ

text.en: as though they were terrified asses
text.ar: كَأَنَّهُمۡ حُمُرࣱ مُّسۡتَنفِرَةࣱ

text.en: fleeing from a lion?
text.ar: فَرَّتۡ مِن قَسۡوَرَةِۭ

text.en: Yea, everyone of them claims that he [himself] ought to have been given revelations unfolded!
text.ar: بَلۡ یُرِیدُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِئࣲ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن یُؤۡتَىٰ صُحُفࣰا مُّنَشَّرَةࣰ

text.en: Nay, but they do not [believe in and, hence, do not] fear the life to come.
text.ar: كَلَّاۖ بَل لَّا یَخَافُونَ ٱلۡـَٔاخِرَةَ

text.en: Nay, verily, this is an admonition –
text.ar: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّهُۥ تَذۡكِرَةࣱ

text.en: and whoever wills may take it to heart.
text.ar: فَمَن شَاۤءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ

text.en: But they [who do not believe in the life to come] will not take it to heart unless God so wills: [for] He is the Fount of all God-consciousness, and the Fount of all forgiveness.
text.ar: وَمَا یَذۡكُرُونَ إِلَّاۤ أَن یَشَاۤءَ ٱللَّهُۚ هُوَ أَهۡلُ ٱلتَّقۡوَىٰ وَأَهۡلُ ٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِ

text.en: NAY! I call to witness the Day of Resurrection!
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ لَاۤ أُقۡسِمُ بِیَوۡمِ ٱلۡقِیَـٰمَةِ

text.en: But nay! I call to witness the accusing voice of man's own conscience!
text.ar: وَلَاۤ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلنَّفۡسِ ٱللَّوَّامَةِ

text.en: Does man think that We cannot [resurrect him and] bring his bones together again?
text.ar: أَیَحۡسَبُ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ أَلَّن نَّجۡمَعَ عِظَامَهُۥ

text.en: Yea indeed, We are able to make whole his very finger-tips!
text.ar: بَلَىٰ قَـٰدِرِینَ عَلَىٰۤ أَن نُّسَوِّیَ بَنَانَهُۥ

text.en: None the less man chooses to deny what lies ahead of him,
text.ar: بَلۡ یُرِیدُ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ لِیَفۡجُرَ أَمَامَهُۥ

text.en: asking [derisively], "When is that Resurrection Day to be?"
text.ar: یَسۡـَٔلُ أَیَّانَ یَوۡمُ ٱلۡقِیَـٰمَةِ

text.en: But [on that Day,] when the eyesight is by fear confounded,
text.ar: فَإِذَا بَرِقَ ٱلۡبَصَرُ

text.en: and the moon is darkened,
text.ar: وَخَسَفَ ٱلۡقَمَرُ

text.en: and the sun and the moon are brought together
text.ar: وَجُمِعَ ٱلشَّمۡسُ وَٱلۡقَمَرُ

text.en: on that Day will man exclaim "Whither to flee?"
text.ar: یَقُولُ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ یَوۡمَىِٕذٍ أَیۡنَ ٱلۡمَفَرُّ

text.en: But nay: no refuge [for thee, O man]!
text.ar: كَلَّا لَا وَزَرَ

text.en: With thy Sustainer, on that Day, the journey's end will be!
text.ar: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ یَوۡمَىِٕذٍ ٱلۡمُسۡتَقَرُّ

text.en: Man will be apprised, on that Day, of what he has done and what he has left undone:
text.ar: یُنَبَّؤُا۟ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ یَوۡمَىِٕذِۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ

text.en: nay, but man shall against himself be an eye-witness,
text.ar: بَلِ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ عَلَىٰ نَفۡسِهِۦ بَصِیرَةࣱ

text.en: even though he may veil himself in excuses.
text.ar: وَلَوۡ أَلۡقَىٰ مَعَاذِیرَهُۥ

text.en: MOVE NOT thy tongue in haste, [repeating the words of the revelation:]
text.ar: لَا تُحَرِّكۡ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعۡجَلَ بِهِۦۤ

text.en: for, behold, it is for Us to gather it [in thy heart,] and to cause it to be read [as it ought to be read].
text.ar: إِنَّ عَلَیۡنَا جَمۡعَهُۥ وَقُرۡءَانَهُۥ

text.en: Thus, when We recite it, follow thou its wording [with all thy mind]:
text.ar: فَإِذَا قَرَأۡنَـٰهُ فَٱتَّبِعۡ قُرۡءَانَهُۥ

text.en: and then, behold, it will be for Us to make its meaning clear.
text.ar: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَیۡنَا بَیَانَهُۥ

text.en: NAY, but [most of] you love this fleeting life,
text.ar: كَلَّا بَلۡ تُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ

text.en: and give no thought to the life to come [and to Judgment Day]!
text.ar: وَتَذَرُونَ ٱلۡـَٔاخِرَةَ

text.en: Some faces will on that Day be bright with happiness,
text.ar: وُجُوهࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ نَّاضِرَةٌ

text.en: looking up to their Sustainer;
text.ar: إِلَىٰ رَبِّهَا نَاظِرَةࣱ

text.en: and some faces will on that Day be overcast with despair,
text.ar: وَوُجُوهࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذِۭ بَاسِرَةࣱ

text.en: knowing that a crushing calamity is about to befall them.
text.ar: تَظُنُّ أَن یُفۡعَلَ بِهَا فَاقِرَةࣱ

text.en: NAY, but when [the last breath] comes up to the throat [of a dying man],
text.ar: كَلَّاۤ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ ٱلتَّرَاقِیَ

text.en: and people ask, "Is there any wizard [that could save him]?"
text.ar: وَقِیلَ مَنۡۜ رَاقࣲ

text.en: the while he [himself] knows that this is the parting,
text.ar: وَظَنَّ أَنَّهُ ٱلۡفِرَاقُ

text.en: and is enwrapped in the pangs of death
text.ar: وَٱلۡتَفَّتِ ٱلسَّاقُ بِٱلسَّاقِ

text.en: at that time towards thy Sustainer does he feel impelled to turn!
text.ar: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ یَوۡمَىِٕذٍ ٱلۡمَسَاقُ

text.en: [Useless, though, will be his repentance: for [as long as he was alive] he did not accept the truth, nor did he pray [for enlightenment],
text.ar: فَلَا صَدَّقَ وَلَا صَلَّىٰ

text.en: but, on the contrary, he gave the lie to the truth and turned away [from it],
text.ar: وَلَـٰكِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

text.en: and then went arrogantly back to what he had come from.
text.ar: ثُمَّ ذَهَبَ إِلَىٰۤ أَهۡلِهِۦ یَتَمَطَّىٰۤ

text.en: [And yet, O man, thine end comes hourly] nearer unto thee, and nearer –
text.ar: أَوۡلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوۡلَىٰ

text.en: and ever nearer unto thee, and nearer!
text.ar: ثُمَّ أَوۡلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوۡلَىٰۤ

text.en: DOES MAN, then, think that he is to be left to himself to go about at will?
text.ar: أَیَحۡسَبُ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ أَن یُتۡرَكَ سُدًى

text.en: Was he not once a [mere] drop of sperm that had been spilt,
text.ar: أَلَمۡ یَكُ نُطۡفَةࣰ مِّن مَّنِیࣲّ یُمۡنَىٰ

text.en: and thereafter became a germ-cell - whereupon He created and formed [it] in accordance with what [it] was meant to be,
text.ar: ثُمَّ كَانَ عَلَقَةࣰ فَخَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ

text.en: and fashioned out of it the two sexes, the male and the female?
text.ar: فَجَعَلَ مِنۡهُ ٱلزَّوۡجَیۡنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰۤ

text.en: Is not He, then; able to bring the dead back to life?
text.ar: أَلَیۡسَ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ بِقَـٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰۤ أَن یُحۡـِۧیَ ٱلۡمَوۡتَىٰ

text.en: HAS THERE [not] been an endless span of time before man [appeared - a time] when he was not yet a thing to be thought of?
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ هَلۡ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنِ حِینࣱ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهۡرِ لَمۡ یَكُن شَیۡـࣰٔا مَّذۡكُورًا

text.en: Verily, it is We who have created man out of a drop of sperm intermingled, so that We might try him [in his later life]: and therefore We made him a being endowed with hearing and sight.
text.ar: إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنَ مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ أَمۡشَاجࣲ نَّبۡتَلِیهِ فَجَعَلۡنَـٰهُ سَمِیعَۢا بَصِیرًا

text.en: Verily, We have shown him the way: [and it rests with him to prove himself] either grateful or ungrateful.
text.ar: إِنَّا هَدَیۡنَـٰهُ ٱلسَّبِیلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرࣰا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا

text.en: [Now,] behold, for those who deny the truth We have readied chains and shackles, and a blazing flame
text.ar: إِنَّاۤ أَعۡتَدۡنَا لِلۡكَـٰفِرِینَ سَلَـٰسِلَا۟ وَأَغۡلَـٰلࣰا وَسَعِیرًا

text.en: [whereas,] behold, the truly virtuous shall drink from a cup flavoured with the calyx of sweet-smelling flowers:
text.ar: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ یَشۡرَبُونَ مِن كَأۡسࣲ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا

text.en: a source [of bliss] whereof God's servants shall drink, seeing it flow in a flow abundant.
text.ar: عَیۡنࣰا یَشۡرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ یُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفۡجِیرࣰا

text.en: [The truly virtuous are] they [who] fulfil their vows, and stand in awe of a Day the woe of which is bound to spread far and wide,
text.ar: یُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذۡرِ وَیَخَافُونَ یَوۡمࣰا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسۡتَطِیرࣰا

text.en: and who give food - however great be their own want of it - unto the needy, and the orphan, and the captive,
text.ar: وَیُطۡعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسۡكِینࣰا وَیَتِیمࣰا وَأَسِیرًا

text.en: [saying, in their hearts,] "We feed you for the sake of God alone: we desire no recompense from you, nor thanks:
text.ar: إِنَّمَا نُطۡعِمُكُمۡ لِوَجۡهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِیدُ مِنكُمۡ جَزَاۤءࣰ وَلَا شُكُورًا

text.en: behold, we stand in awe of our Sustainer's judgment on a distressful, fateful Day!"
text.ar: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا یَوۡمًا عَبُوسࣰا قَمۡطَرِیرࣰا

text.en: And so, God will preserve them from the woes of that Day, and will bestow on them brightness and joy,
text.ar: فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ ٱلۡیَوۡمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمۡ نَضۡرَةࣰ وَسُرُورࣰا

text.en: and will reward them for all their patience in adversity with a garden [of bliss] and with [garments of] silk.
text.ar: وَجَزَىٰهُم بِمَا صَبَرُوا۟ جَنَّةࣰ وَحَرِیرࣰا

text.en: In that [garden] they will on couches recline, and will know therein neither [burning] sun nor cold severe,
text.ar: مُّتَّكِـِٔینَ فِیهَا عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَاۤىِٕكِۖ لَا یَرَوۡنَ فِیهَا شَمۡسࣰا وَلَا زَمۡهَرِیرࣰا

text.en: since its [blissful] shades will come down low over them, and low will hang down its clusters of fruit, most easy to reach.
text.ar: وَدَانِیَةً عَلَیۡهِمۡ ظِلَـٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتۡ قُطُوفُهَا تَذۡلِیلࣰا

text.en: And they will be waited upon with vessels of silver and goblets that will [seem to] be crystal –
text.ar: وَیُطَافُ عَلَیۡهِم بِـَٔانِیَةࣲ مِّن فِضَّةࣲ وَأَكۡوَابࣲ كَانَتۡ قَوَارِیرَا۠

text.en: crystal-like, [but] of silver - the measure whereof they alone will determine.
text.ar: قَوَارِیرَا۟ مِن فِضَّةࣲ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقۡدِیرࣰا

text.en: And in that [paradise] they will be given to drink of a cup flavoured with ginger,
text.ar: وَیُسۡقَوۡنَ فِیهَا كَأۡسࣰا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِیلًا

text.en: [derived from] a source [to be found] therein, whose name is "Seek Thy Way".
text.ar: عَیۡنࣰا فِیهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلۡسَبِیلࣰا

text.en: And immortal youths will wait upon them: when thou seest them, thou wouldst deem them to be scattered pearls;
text.ar: ۞ وَیَطُوفُ عَلَیۡهِمۡ وِلۡدَ ٰ⁠نࣱ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَیۡتَهُمۡ حَسِبۡتَهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤࣰا مَّنثُورࣰا

text.en: and when thou seest [anything that is] there thou wilt see [only] bliss and a realm transcendent
text.ar: وَإِذَا رَأَیۡتَ ثَمَّ رَأَیۡتَ نَعِیمࣰا وَمُلۡكࣰا كَبِیرًا

text.en: Upon those [blest] will be garments of green silk and brocade; and they will be adorned with bracelets of silver. And their Sustainer will them to drink of a drink most pure.
text.ar: عَـٰلِیَهُمۡ ثِیَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضۡرࣱ وَإِسۡتَبۡرَقࣱۖ وَحُلُّوۤا۟ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةࣲ وَسَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ شَرَابࣰا طَهُورًا

text.en: [And they will be told:] "Verily, all this is your reward since Your endeavour [in life] has met [God's] goodly acceptance!"
text.ar: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمۡ جَزَاۤءࣰ وَكَانَ سَعۡیُكُم مَّشۡكُورًا

text.en: VERILY, [O believer,] it is We who have bestowed from on high this Qur’an upon thee, step by step - truly a bestowal from on high!
text.ar: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نَزَّلۡنَا عَلَیۡكَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَنزِیلࣰا

text.en: Await, then, in all patience thy Sustainer's judgment, and pay no heed to any of them, who is a wilful sinner or an ingrate;
text.ar: فَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعۡ مِنۡهُمۡ ءَاثِمًا أَوۡ كَفُورࣰا

text.en: and bear in mind thy Sustainer's name at morn and evening
text.ar: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ بُكۡرَةࣰ وَأَصِیلࣰا

text.en: and during some of the night, and prostrate thyself before Him, and extol His limitless glory throughout the long night.
text.ar: وَمِنَ ٱلَّیۡلِ فَٱسۡجُدۡ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحۡهُ لَیۡلࣰا طَوِیلًا

text.en: Behold, they [who are unmindful of God] love this fleeting life, and leave behind them [all thought of] a grief-laden Day.
text.ar: إِنَّ هَـٰۤؤُلَاۤءِ یُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ وَیَذَرُونَ وَرَاۤءَهُمۡ یَوۡمࣰا ثَقِیلࣰا

text.en: [They will not admit to themselves that] it We who have created them and strengthened their make - and [that] if it be Our will We can replace them entirely with others of their kind.
text.ar: نَّحۡنُ خَلَقۡنَـٰهُمۡ وَشَدَدۡنَاۤ أَسۡرَهُمۡۖ وَإِذَا شِئۡنَا بَدَّلۡنَاۤ أَمۡثَـٰلَهُمۡ تَبۡدِیلًا

text.en: VERILY, all this is an admonition: whoever, then, so wills, may unto his Sustainer find a way.
text.ar: إِنَّ هَـٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةࣱۖ فَمَن شَاۤءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِیلࣰا

text.en: But you cannot will it unless God wills [to show you that way]: for, behold, God is indeed all-seeing, wise.
text.ar: وَمَا تَشَاۤءُونَ إِلَّاۤ أَن یَشَاۤءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِیمًا حَكِیمࣰا

text.en: He admits unto His grace everyone who wills [to be admitted]; but as for the evildoers - for them has He readied grievous suffering [in the life to come].
text.ar: یُدۡخِلُ مَن یَشَاۤءُ فِی رَحۡمَتِهِۦۚ وَٱلظَّـٰلِمِینَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمۡ عَذَابًا أَلِیمَۢا

text.en: CONSIDER these [messages,] sent forth in waves
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ وَٱلۡمُرۡسَلَـٰتِ عُرۡفࣰا

text.en: and then storming on with a tempest's force!
text.ar: فَٱلۡعَـٰصِفَـٰتِ عَصۡفࣰا

text.en: Consider these [messages] that spread [the truth] far and wide,
text.ar: وَٱلنَّـٰشِرَ ٰ⁠تِ نَشۡرࣰا

text.en: thus separating [right and wrong] with all clarity,
text.ar: فَٱلۡفَـٰرِقَـٰتِ فَرۡقࣰا

text.en: and then giving forth a reminder,
text.ar: فَٱلۡمُلۡقِیَـٰتِ ذِكۡرًا

text.en: [promising] freedom from blame or [offering] a warning!
text.ar: عُذۡرًا أَوۡ نُذۡرًا

text.en: BEHOLD, all that you are told to expect will surely come to pass.
text.ar: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَوَ ٰ⁠قِعࣱ

text.en: Thus, [it will come to pass] when the stars are effaced,
text.ar: فَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ طُمِسَتۡ

text.en: and when the sky is rent asunder,
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ فُرِجَتۡ

text.en: and when the mountains are scattered like dust,
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجِبَالُ نُسِفَتۡ

text.en: and when all the apostles are called together at a time appointed...
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلرُّسُلُ أُقِّتَتۡ

text.en: For what day has the term [of all this] been set?
text.ar: لِأَیِّ یَوۡمٍ أُجِّلَتۡ

text.en: For the Day of Distinction [between the true and the false]!
text.ar: لِیَوۡمِ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ

text.en: And what could make thee conceive what that Day of Distinction will be?
text.ar: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا یَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ

text.en: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
text.ar: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ

text.en: Did We not destroy [so many of] those [sinners] of olden days?
text.ar: أَلَمۡ نُهۡلِكِ ٱلۡأَوَّلِینَ

text.en: And We shall let them be followed by those of later times:
text.ar: ثُمَّ نُتۡبِعُهُمُ ٱلۡـَٔاخِرِینَ

text.en: [for] thus do We deal with such as are lost in sin.
text.ar: كَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ نَفۡعَلُ بِٱلۡمُجۡرِمِینَ

text.en: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
text.ar: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ

text.en: Did We not create you out of a humble fluid
text.ar: أَلَمۡ نَخۡلُقكُّم مِّن مَّاۤءࣲ مَّهِینࣲ

text.en: which We then let remain in [the womb's] firm keeping
text.ar: فَجَعَلۡنَـٰهُ فِی قَرَارࣲ مَّكِینٍ

text.en: for a term pre-ordained?
text.ar: إِلَىٰ قَدَرࣲ مَّعۡلُومࣲ

text.en: Thus have We determined [the nature of man's creation]: and excellent indeed is Our power to determine [what is to be]!
text.ar: فَقَدَرۡنَا فَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡقَـٰدِرُونَ

text.en: Woe, on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
text.ar: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ

text.en: Have We not caused the earth to hold within itself
text.ar: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَلِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ كِفَاتًا

text.en: the living and the dead?
text.ar: أَحۡیَاۤءࣰ وَأَمۡوَ ٰ⁠تࣰا

text.en: and have We not set on it proud, firm mountains, and given you sweet water to drink?
text.ar: وَجَعَلۡنَا فِیهَا رَوَ ٰ⁠سِیَ شَـٰمِخَـٰتࣲ وَأَسۡقَیۡنَـٰكُم مَّاۤءࣰ فُرَاتࣰا

text.en: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
text.ar: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ

text.en: GO ON towards that [resurrection] which you were wont to call a lie!
text.ar: ٱنطَلِقُوۤا۟ إِلَىٰ مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ

text.en: Go on towards the threefold shadow
text.ar: ٱنطَلِقُوۤا۟ إِلَىٰ ظِلࣲّ ذِی ثَلَـٰثِ شُعَبࣲ

text.en: that will offer no [cooling] shade and will be of no avail against the flame
text.ar: لَّا ظَلِیلࣲ وَلَا یُغۡنِی مِنَ ٱللَّهَبِ

text.en: which – behold!- will throw up sparks like [burning] logs,
text.ar: إِنَّهَا تَرۡمِی بِشَرَرࣲ كَٱلۡقَصۡرِ

text.en: like giant fiery ropes!
text.ar: كَأَنَّهُۥ جِمَـٰلَتࣱ صُفۡرࣱ

text.en: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth –
text.ar: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ

text.en: that Day on which they will not [be able to] utter a word,
text.ar: هَـٰذَا یَوۡمُ لَا یَنطِقُونَ

text.en: nor be allowed to proffer excuses!
text.ar: وَلَا یُؤۡذَنُ لَهُمۡ فَیَعۡتَذِرُونَ

text.en: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth –
text.ar: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ

text.en: that Day of Distinction [between the true and the false, when they will be told]: "We have brought you together with those [sinners] of olden times;
text.ar: هَـٰذَا یَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِۖ جَمَعۡنَـٰكُمۡ وَٱلۡأَوَّلِینَ

text.en: and if you [think that you] have a subterfuge left, try to outwit Me!"
text.ar: فَإِن كَانَ لَكُمۡ كَیۡدࣱ فَكِیدُونِ

text.en: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
text.ar: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ

text.en: [AS AGAINST this,] behold, the God-conscious shall dwell amidst [cooling] shades and springs,
text.ar: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِینَ فِی ظِلَـٰلࣲ وَعُیُونࣲ

text.en: and [partake of] whatever fruit they may desire;
text.ar: وَفَوَ ٰ⁠كِهَ مِمَّا یَشۡتَهُونَ

text.en: [and they will be told:] "Eat and drink in good cheer in return for what you did [in life]!"
text.ar: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشۡرَبُوا۟ هَنِیۤـَٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ

text.en: Thus, behold, do We reward the doers of good;
text.ar: إِنَّا كَذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ نَجۡزِی ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِینَ

text.en: [but] woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
text.ar: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ

text.en: EAT [your fill] and enjoy your life for a little while, O you who are lost in sin!
text.ar: كُلُوا۟ وَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ قَلِیلًا إِنَّكُم مُّجۡرِمُونَ

text.en: [But] woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth,
text.ar: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ

text.en: and when they are told, "Bow down [before God]", do not bow down:
text.ar: وَإِذَا قِیلَ لَهُمُ ٱرۡكَعُوا۟ لَا یَرۡكَعُونَ

text.en: woe on that Day unto those who give the to the truth!
text.ar: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ

text.en: In what other tiding, then, will they, after this, believe?
text.ar: فَبِأَیِّ حَدِیثِۭ بَعۡدَهُۥ یُؤۡمِنُونَ

text.en: ABOUT WHAT do they [most often] ask one another?
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ عَمَّ یَتَسَاۤءَلُونَ

text.en: About the awesome tiding [of resurrection],
text.ar: عَنِ ٱلنَّبَإِ ٱلۡعَظِیمِ

text.en: on which they [so utterly] disagree.
text.ar: ٱلَّذِی هُمۡ فِیهِ مُخۡتَلِفُونَ

text.en: Nay, but in time they will come to understand [it]!
text.ar: كَلَّا سَیَعۡلَمُونَ

text.en: And once again: Nay, but in time they will come to understand!
text.ar: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَیَعۡلَمُونَ

text.en: HAVE WE NOT made the earth a resting-place [for you],
text.ar: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَلِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ مِهَـٰدࣰا

text.en: and the mountains [its] pegs?
text.ar: وَٱلۡجِبَالَ أَوۡتَادࣰا

text.en: And We have created you in pairs;
text.ar: وَخَلَقۡنَـٰكُمۡ أَزۡوَ ٰ⁠جࣰا

text.en: and We have made your sleep [a symbol of] death
text.ar: وَجَعَلۡنَا نَوۡمَكُمۡ سُبَاتࣰا

text.en: and made the night [its] cloak
text.ar: وَجَعَلۡنَا ٱلَّیۡلَ لِبَاسࣰا

text.en: and made the day [a symbol of] life.
text.ar: وَجَعَلۡنَا ٱلنَّهَارَ مَعَاشࣰا

text.en: And We have built above you seven firmaments,
text.ar: وَبَنَیۡنَا فَوۡقَكُمۡ سَبۡعࣰا شِدَادࣰا

text.en: and have placed [therein the sun,] a lamp full of blazing splendour.
text.ar: وَجَعَلۡنَا سِرَاجࣰا وَهَّاجࣰا

text.en: And from the wind-driven clouds We send down waters pouring in abundance,
text.ar: وَأَنزَلۡنَا مِنَ ٱلۡمُعۡصِرَ ٰ⁠تِ مَاۤءࣰ ثَجَّاجࣰا

text.en: so that We might bring forth thereby grain, and herbs,
text.ar: لِّنُخۡرِجَ بِهِۦ حَبࣰّا وَنَبَاتࣰا

text.en: and gardens dense with follage.
text.ar: وَجَنَّـٰتٍ أَلۡفَافًا

text.en: VERILY, the Day of Distinction [between the true and the false] has indeed its appointed time:
text.ar: إِنَّ یَوۡمَ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ كَانَ مِیقَـٰتࣰا

text.en: the Day when the trumpet [of resurrection] is sounded and you all come forward in multitudes;
text.ar: یَوۡمَ یُنفَخُ فِی ٱلصُّورِ فَتَأۡتُونَ أَفۡوَاجࣰا

text.en: and when the skies are opened and become [as wide-flung] gates;
text.ar: وَفُتِحَتِ ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ فَكَانَتۡ أَبۡوَ ٰ⁠بࣰا

text.en: and when the mountains are made to vanish as if they had been a mirage.
text.ar: وَسُیِّرَتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ فَكَانَتۡ سَرَابًا

text.en: [On that Day,] verily, hell will lie in wait [for those who deny the truth] –
text.ar: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتۡ مِرۡصَادࣰا

text.en: a goal for all who are wont to transgress the bounds of what is right!
text.ar: لِّلطَّـٰغِینَ مَـَٔابࣰا

text.en: In it shall they remain for a long time.
text.ar: لَّـٰبِثِینَ فِیهَاۤ أَحۡقَابࣰا

text.en: Neither coolness shall they taste therein nor any [thirst-quenching] drink –
text.ar: لَّا یَذُوقُونَ فِیهَا بَرۡدࣰا وَلَا شَرَابًا

text.en: only burning despair and ice-cold darkness:
text.ar: إِلَّا حَمِیمࣰا وَغَسَّاقࣰا

text.en: a meet requital [for their sins]!
text.ar: جَزَاۤءࣰ وِفَاقًا

text.en: Behold, they were not expecting to be called to account,
text.ar: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُوا۟ لَا یَرۡجُونَ حِسَابࣰا

text.en: having given the lie to Our messages one and all:
text.ar: وَكَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔایَـٰتِنَا كِذَّابࣰا

text.en: but We have placed on record every single thing [of what they did].
text.ar: وَكُلَّ شَیۡءٍ أَحۡصَیۡنَـٰهُ كِتَـٰبࣰا

text.en: [And so We shall say:] "Taste, then, [the fruit of your evil doings,] for now We shall bestow on you nothing but more and more suffering!"
text.ar: فَذُوقُوا۟ فَلَن نَّزِیدَكُمۡ إِلَّا عَذَابًا

text.en: [But,] verily for the God-conscious there is supreme fulfilment in store:
text.ar: إِنَّ لِلۡمُتَّقِینَ مَفَازًا

text.en: luxuriant gardens and vinyards,
text.ar: حَدَاۤىِٕقَ وَأَعۡنَـٰبࣰا

text.en: and splendid companions well matched,
text.ar: وَكَوَاعِبَ أَتۡرَابࣰا

text.en: and a cup [of happiness] overflowing.
text.ar: وَكَأۡسࣰا دِهَاقࣰا

text.en: No empty talk will they hear in that [paradise], nor any lie.
text.ar: لَّا یَسۡمَعُونَ فِیهَا لَغۡوࣰا وَلَا كِذَّ ٰ⁠بࣰا

text.en: [All this will be] a reward from thy Sustainer, a gift in accordance with [His Own] reckoning –
text.ar: جَزَاۤءࣰ مِّن رَّبِّكَ عَطَاۤءً حِسَابࣰا

text.en: [a reward from] the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Most Gracious! [And] none shall have it in their power to raise their voices unto Him
text.ar: رَّبِّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَیۡنَهُمَا ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِۖ لَا یَمۡلِكُونَ مِنۡهُ خِطَابࣰا

text.en: on the Day when all [human] souls and all the angels will stand up in ranks: none will speak but he to whom the Most Gracious will have given leave; and [everyone] will say [only] what is right.
text.ar: یَوۡمَ یَقُومُ ٱلرُّوحُ وَٱلۡمَلَـٰۤىِٕكَةُ صَفࣰّاۖ لَّا یَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنۡ أَذِنَ لَهُ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابࣰا

text.en: That will be the Day of Ultimate Truth: whoever wills, then, let him take the path that leads towards his Sustainer!
text.ar: ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ ٱلۡیَوۡمُ ٱلۡحَقُّۖ فَمَن شَاۤءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ مَـَٔابًا

text.en: Verily, We have warned you of suffering near at hand - [suffering] on the Day when man shall [clearly] see what his hands have sent ahead, and when he who has denied the truth shall say, "Oh, would that I were mere dust...!"
text.ar: إِنَّاۤ أَنذَرۡنَـٰكُمۡ عَذَابࣰا قَرِیبࣰا یَوۡمَ یَنظُرُ ٱلۡمَرۡءُ مَا قَدَّمَتۡ یَدَاهُ وَیَقُولُ ٱلۡكَافِرُ یَـٰلَیۡتَنِی كُنتُ تُرَ ٰ⁠بَۢا

text.en: CONSIDER those [stars] that rise only to set,
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ وَٱلنَّـٰزِعَـٰتِ غَرۡقࣰا

text.en: and move [in their orbits] with steady motion,
text.ar: وَٱلنَّـٰشِطَـٰتِ نَشۡطࣰا

text.en: and float [through space] with floating serene,
text.ar: وَٱلسَّـٰبِحَـٰتِ سَبۡحࣰا

text.en: and yet overtake [one another] with swift overtaking:
text.ar: فَٱلسَّـٰبِقَـٰتِ سَبۡقࣰا

text.en: and thus they fulfil the [Creator's] behest!
text.ar: فَٱلۡمُدَبِّرَ ٰ⁠تِ أَمۡرࣰا

text.en: [HENCE, think of] the Day when a violent convulsion will convulse [the world],
text.ar: یَوۡمَ تَرۡجُفُ ٱلرَّاجِفَةُ

text.en: to be followed by further [convulsions]!
text.ar: تَتۡبَعُهَا ٱلرَّادِفَةُ

text.en: On that Day will [men's] hearts be throbbing,
text.ar: قُلُوبࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ وَاجِفَةٌ

text.en: [and] their eyes downcast...
text.ar: أَبۡصَـٰرُهَا خَـٰشِعَةࣱ

text.en: [And yet,] some say, "What! Are we indeed to be restored to our former state –
text.ar: یَقُولُونَ أَءِنَّا لَمَرۡدُودُونَ فِی ٱلۡحَافِرَةِ

text.en: even though we may have become [a heap of] crumbling bones?"
text.ar: أَءِذَا كُنَّا عِظَـٰمࣰا نَّخِرَةࣰ

text.en: [And] they add, "That, then, would be a return with loss!"
text.ar: قَالُوا۟ تِلۡكَ إِذࣰا كَرَّةٌ خَاسِرَةࣱ

text.en: [But,] then, that [Last Hour] will be [upon them of a sudden, as if it were] but a single accusing cry -
text.ar: فَإِنَّمَا هِیَ زَجۡرَةࣱ وَ ٰ⁠حِدَةࣱ

text.en: and then, lo, they will be fully awakened [to the truth]!
text.ar: فَإِذَا هُم بِٱلسَّاهِرَةِ

text.en: HAS THE STORY of Moses ever come within thy ken.
text.ar: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِیثُ مُوسَىٰۤ

text.en: Lo! His Sustainer called out to him in the twice-hallowed valley:
text.ar: إِذۡ نَادَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ بِٱلۡوَادِ ٱلۡمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى

text.en: "Go unto Pharaoh - for, verily, he has transgressed all bounds of what is right -
text.ar: ٱذۡهَبۡ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ إِنَّهُۥ طَغَىٰ

text.en: and say [unto him], 'Art thou desirous of attaining to purity?
text.ar: فَقُلۡ هَل لَّكَ إِلَىٰۤ أَن تَزَكَّىٰ

text.en: [If so,] then I shall guide thee towards [a cognition of] thy Sustainer, so that [henceforth] thou wilt stand in awe [of Him].’"
text.ar: وَأَهۡدِیَكَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَتَخۡشَىٰ

text.en: And thereupon he [went to Pharaoh and] made him aware of the great wonder [of God's grace].
text.ar: فَأَرَىٰهُ ٱلۡـَٔایَةَ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ

text.en: But [Pharaoh] gave him the lie and rebelliously rejected [all guidance],
text.ar: فَكَذَّبَ وَعَصَىٰ

text.en: and brusquely turned his back [on Moses];
text.ar: ثُمَّ أَدۡبَرَ یَسۡعَىٰ

text.en: and then he gathered [his great ones], and called [unto his people],
text.ar: فَحَشَرَ فَنَادَىٰ

text.en: and said, "I am your Lord All-Highest!"
text.ar: فَقَالَ أَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمُ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ

text.en: And thereupon God took him to task, [and made him] a warning example in the life to come as well as in this world.
text.ar: فَأَخَذَهُ ٱللَّهُ نَكَالَ ٱلۡـَٔاخِرَةِ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰۤ

text.en: In this, behold, there is a lesson indeed for all who stand in awe [of God].
text.ar: إِنَّ فِی ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ لَعِبۡرَةࣰ لِّمَن یَخۡشَىٰۤ

text.en: [O MEN!] Are you more difficult to create than the heaven which He has built?
text.ar: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَشَدُّ خَلۡقًا أَمِ ٱلسَّمَاۤءُۚ بَنَىٰهَا

text.en: High has He reared its vault and formed it in accordance with what it was meant to be;
text.ar: رَفَعَ سَمۡكَهَا فَسَوَّىٰهَا

text.en: and He has made dark its night and brought forth its light of day.
text.ar: وَأَغۡطَشَ لَیۡلَهَا وَأَخۡرَجَ ضُحَىٰهَا

text.en: And after that, the earth: wide has He spread its expanse,
text.ar: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ بَعۡدَ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ دَحَىٰهَاۤ

text.en: and has caused its waters to come out of it, and its pastures,
text.ar: أَخۡرَجَ مِنۡهَا مَاۤءَهَا وَمَرۡعَىٰهَا

text.en: and has made the mountains firm:
text.ar: وَٱلۡجِبَالَ أَرۡسَىٰهَا

text.en: [all this] as a means of livelihood for you and your animals.
text.ar: مَتَـٰعࣰا لَّكُمۡ وَلِأَنۡعَـٰمِكُمۡ

text.en: AND SO, when the great overwhelming event [of, resurrection] comes to pass –
text.ar: فَإِذَا جَاۤءَتِ ٱلطَّاۤمَّةُ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ

text.en: on that Day man will [clearly] remember all that he has ever wrought;
text.ar: یَوۡمَ یَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ مَا سَعَىٰ

text.en: and the blazing fire [of hell] will be lad open before all who [are destined to] see it.
text.ar: وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلۡجَحِیمُ لِمَن یَرَىٰ

text.en: For, unto him who shall have transgressed the bounds of what is right,
text.ar: فَأَمَّا مَن طَغَىٰ

text.en: and preferred the life of this world [to the good of his soul],
text.ar: وَءَاثَرَ ٱلۡحَیَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡیَا

text.en: that blazing fire will truly be the goal!
text.ar: فَإِنَّ ٱلۡجَحِیمَ هِیَ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰ

text.en: But unto him who shall have stood in fear of his Sustainer's Presence, and held back his inner self from base desires,
text.ar: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ وَنَهَى ٱلنَّفۡسَ عَنِ ٱلۡهَوَىٰ

text.en: paradise will truly be the goal!
text.ar: فَإِنَّ ٱلۡجَنَّةَ هِیَ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰ

text.en: THEY WILL ASK thee [O Prophet] about the Last Hour: "When will it come to pass?"
text.ar: یَسۡـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلسَّاعَةِ أَیَّانَ مُرۡسَىٰهَا

text.en: [But] how couldst thou tell anything about it,
text.ar: فِیمَ أَنتَ مِن ذِكۡرَىٰهَاۤ

text.en: [seeing that] with thy Sustainer alone rests the beginning and the end [of all knowledge] thereof?
text.ar: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ مُنتَهَىٰهَاۤ

text.en: Thou art but [sent] to warn those who stand in awe of it.
text.ar: إِنَّمَاۤ أَنتَ مُنذِرُ مَن یَخۡشَىٰهَا

text.en: On the Day when they behold it, [it will seem to them] as if they had tarried [in this world] no longer than one evening or [one night, ending with] its morn!
text.ar: كَأَنَّهُمۡ یَوۡمَ یَرَوۡنَهَا لَمۡ یَلۡبَثُوۤا۟ إِلَّا عَشِیَّةً أَوۡ ضُحَىٰهَا

text.en: HE FROWNED and turned away
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰۤ

text.en: because the blind man approached him!
text.ar: أَن جَاۤءَهُ ٱلۡأَعۡمَىٰ

text.en: Yet for all thou didst know, [O Muhammad,] he might perhaps have grown in purity,
text.ar: وَمَا یُدۡرِیكَ لَعَلَّهُۥ یَزَّكَّىٰۤ

text.en: or have been reminded [of the truth], and helped by this reminder.
text.ar: أَوۡ یَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنفَعَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰۤ

text.en: Now as for him who believes himself to be self-sufficient
text.ar: أَمَّا مَنِ ٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰ

text.en: to him didst thou give thy whole attention,
text.ar: فَأَنتَ لَهُۥ تَصَدَّىٰ

text.en: although thou art not accountable for his failure to attain to purity;
text.ar: وَمَا عَلَیۡكَ أَلَّا یَزَّكَّىٰ

text.en: but as for him who came unto thee full of eagerness
text.ar: وَأَمَّا مَن جَاۤءَكَ یَسۡعَىٰ

text.en: and in awe [of God]
text.ar: وَهُوَ یَخۡشَىٰ

text.en: him didst thou disregard!
text.ar: فَأَنتَ عَنۡهُ تَلَهَّىٰ

text.en: NAY, VERILY, these [messages] are but a reminder:
text.ar: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّهَا تَذۡكِرَةࣱ

text.en: and so, whoever is willing may remember Him
text.ar: فَمَن شَاۤءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ

text.en: in [the light of His] revelations blest with dignity,
text.ar: فِی صُحُفࣲ مُّكَرَّمَةࣲ

text.en: lofty and pure,
text.ar: مَّرۡفُوعَةࣲ مُّطَهَّرَةِۭ

text.en: [borne] by the hands of messengers
text.ar: بِأَیۡدِی سَفَرَةࣲ

text.en: noble and most virtuous.
text.ar: كِرَامِۭ بَرَرَةࣲ

text.en: [But only too often] man destroys himself: how stubbornly does he deny the truth!
text.ar: قُتِلَ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ مَاۤ أَكۡفَرَهُۥ

text.en: [Does man ever consider] out of what substance [God] creates him?
text.ar: مِنۡ أَیِّ شَیۡءٍ خَلَقَهُۥ

text.en: Out of a drop of sperm He creates him, and thereupon determines his nature,
text.ar: مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ خَلَقَهُۥ فَقَدَّرَهُۥ

text.en: and then makes it easy for him to go through life;
text.ar: ثُمَّ ٱلسَّبِیلَ یَسَّرَهُۥ

text.en: and in the end He causes him to die and brings him to the grave;
text.ar: ثُمَّ أَمَاتَهُۥ فَأَقۡبَرَهُۥ

text.en: and then, if it be His will, He shall raise him again to life,
text.ar: ثُمَّ إِذَا شَاۤءَ أَنشَرَهُۥ

text.en: Nay, but [man] has never yet fulfilled what He has enjoined upon him!
text.ar: كَلَّا لَمَّا یَقۡضِ مَاۤ أَمَرَهُۥ

text.en: Let man, then, consider [the sources of] his food:
text.ar: فَلۡیَنظُرِ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِۦۤ

text.en: [how it is] that We pour down water, pouring it down abundantly;
text.ar: أَنَّا صَبَبۡنَا ٱلۡمَاۤءَ صَبࣰّا

text.en: and then We cleave the earth [with new growth], cleaving it asunder,
text.ar: ثُمَّ شَقَقۡنَا ٱلۡأَرۡضَ شَقࣰّا

text.en: and thereupon We cause grain to grow out of it,
text.ar: فَأَنۢبَتۡنَا فِیهَا حَبࣰّا

text.en: and vines and edible plants,
text.ar: وَعِنَبࣰا وَقَضۡبࣰا

text.en: and olive trees and date-palms,
text.ar: وَزَیۡتُونࣰا وَنَخۡلࣰا

text.en: and gardens dense with foliage,
text.ar: وَحَدَاۤىِٕقَ غُلۡبࣰا

text.en: and fruits and herbage,
text.ar: وَفَـٰكِهَةࣰ وَأَبࣰّا

text.en: for you and for your animals to enjoy.
text.ar: مَّتَـٰعࣰا لَّكُمۡ وَلِأَنۡعَـٰمِكُمۡ

text.en: AND SO, when the piercing call [of resurrection] is heard
text.ar: فَإِذَا جَاۤءَتِ ٱلصَّاۤخَّةُ

text.en: on a Day when everyone will [want to] flee from his brother,
text.ar: یَوۡمَ یَفِرُّ ٱلۡمَرۡءُ مِنۡ أَخِیهِ

text.en: and from his mother and father,
text.ar: وَأُمِّهِۦ وَأَبِیهِ

text.en: and from his spouse and his children:
text.ar: وَصَـٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَبَنِیهِ

text.en: on that Day, to every one of them will his own state be of sufficient concern.
text.ar: لِكُلِّ ٱمۡرِئࣲ مِّنۡهُمۡ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ شَأۡنࣱ یُغۡنِیهِ

text.en: Some faces will on that Day be bright with happiness,
text.ar: وُجُوهࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ مُّسۡفِرَةࣱ

text.en: laughing, rejoicing at glad tidings.
text.ar: ضَاحِكَةࣱ مُّسۡتَبۡشِرَةࣱ

text.en: And some faces will on that Day with dust be covered,
text.ar: وَوُجُوهࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذٍ عَلَیۡهَا غَبَرَةࣱ

text.en: with darkness overspread:
text.ar: تَرۡهَقُهَا قَتَرَةٌ

text.en: these, these will be the ones who denied the truth and were immersed in iniquity!
text.ar: أُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ هُمُ ٱلۡكَفَرَةُ ٱلۡفَجَرَةُ

text.en: WHEN THE SUN is shrouded in darkness,
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ إِذَا ٱلشَّمۡسُ كُوِّرَتۡ

text.en: and when the stars lose their light,
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ ٱنكَدَرَتۡ

text.en: and when the mountains are made to vanish,
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجِبَالُ سُیِّرَتۡ

text.en: and when she-camels big with young, about to give birth, are left untended,
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلۡعِشَارُ عُطِّلَتۡ

text.en: and when all beasts are gathered together,
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلۡوُحُوشُ حُشِرَتۡ

text.en: and when the seas boil over,
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلۡبِحَارُ سُجِّرَتۡ

text.en: and when all human beings are coupled [with their deeds],
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّفُوسُ زُوِّجَتۡ

text.en: and when the girl-child that was buried alive is made to ask
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلۡمَوۡءُۥدَةُ سُىِٕلَتۡ

text.en: for what crime she had been slain,
text.ar: بِأَیِّ ذَنۢبࣲ قُتِلَتۡ

text.en: and when the scrolls [of men's deeds] are unfolded,
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلصُّحُفُ نُشِرَتۡ

text.en: and when heaven is laid bare,
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ كُشِطَتۡ

text.en: and when the blazing fire [of hell] is kindled bright,
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجَحِیمُ سُعِّرَتۡ

text.en: and when paradise is brought into view:
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجَنَّةُ أُزۡلِفَتۡ

text.en: [on that Day] every human being will come to know what he has prepared [for himself].
text.ar: عَلِمَتۡ نَفۡسࣱ مَّاۤ أَحۡضَرَتۡ

text.en: BUT NAY! I call to witness the revolving stars,
text.ar: فَلَاۤ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلۡخُنَّسِ

text.en: the planets that run their course and set,
text.ar: ٱلۡجَوَارِ ٱلۡكُنَّسِ

text.en: and the night as it darkly falls,
text.ar: وَٱلَّیۡلِ إِذَا عَسۡعَسَ

text.en: and the morn as it softly breathes:
text.ar: وَٱلصُّبۡحِ إِذَا تَنَفَّسَ

text.en: behold, this [divine writ] is indeed the [inspired] word of a noble apostle,
text.ar: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوۡلُ رَسُولࣲ كَرِیمࣲ

text.en: with strength endowed, secure with Him who in almightiness is enthroned
text.ar: ذِی قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِی ٱلۡعَرۡشِ مَكِینࣲ

text.en: [the word] of one to be heeded, and worthy of trust!
text.ar: مُّطَاعࣲ ثَمَّ أَمِینࣲ

text.en: For, this fellow-man of yours is not a madman:
text.ar: وَمَا صَاحِبُكُم بِمَجۡنُونࣲ

text.en: he truly beheld [the angel - beheld] him on the clear horizon;
text.ar: وَلَقَدۡ رَءَاهُ بِٱلۡأُفُقِ ٱلۡمُبِینِ

text.en: and he is not one to begrudge others the knowledge [of whatever has been revealed to him] out of that which is beyond the reach of human Perception.
text.ar: وَمَا هُوَ عَلَى ٱلۡغَیۡبِ بِضَنِینࣲ

text.en: Nor is this [message] the word of any satanic force accursed.
text.ar: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوۡلِ شَیۡطَـٰنࣲ رَّجِیمࣲ

text.en: Whither, then, will you go?
text.ar: فَأَیۡنَ تَذۡهَبُونَ

text.en: This [message] is no less than a reminder to all mankind –
text.ar: إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرࣱ لِّلۡعَـٰلَمِینَ

text.en: to everyone of you who wills to walk a straight way.
text.ar: لِمَن شَاۤءَ مِنكُمۡ أَن یَسۡتَقِیمَ

text.en: But you cannot will it unless God, the Sustainer of all the worlds, wills [to show you that way].
text.ar: وَمَا تَشَاۤءُونَ إِلَّاۤ أَن یَشَاۤءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلۡعَـٰلَمِینَ

text.en: WHEN THE SKY is cleft asunder,
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ إِذَا ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ ٱنفَطَرَتۡ

text.en: and when the stars are scattered,
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلۡكَوَاكِبُ ٱنتَثَرَتۡ

text.en: and when the seas burst beyond their bounds,
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلۡبِحَارُ فُجِّرَتۡ

text.en: and when the graves are overturned –
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلۡقُبُورُ بُعۡثِرَتۡ

text.en: every human being will [at last] comprehend, what he has sent ahead and what he has held back [in this world].
text.ar: عَلِمَتۡ نَفۡسࣱ مَّا قَدَّمَتۡ وَأَخَّرَتۡ

text.en: O MAN! What is it that lures thee away from thy bountiful Sustainer,
text.ar: یَـٰۤأَیُّهَا ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ ٱلۡكَرِیمِ

text.en: who has created thee, and formed thee in accordance with what thou art meant' to be, and shaped thy nature in just proportions,
text.ar: ٱلَّذِی خَلَقَكَ فَسَوَّىٰكَ فَعَدَلَكَ

text.en: having put thee together in whatever form He willed [thee to have]?
text.ar: فِیۤ أَیِّ صُورَةࣲ مَّا شَاۤءَ رَكَّبَكَ

text.en: Nay, [O men,] but you [are lured away from God whenever you are tempted to] give the lie to [God’s] Judgment!
text.ar: كَلَّا بَلۡ تُكَذِّبُونَ بِٱلدِّینِ

text.en: And yet, verily, there are ever-watchful forces over you,
text.ar: وَإِنَّ عَلَیۡكُمۡ لَحَـٰفِظِینَ

text.en: noble, recording,
text.ar: كِرَامࣰا كَـٰتِبِینَ

text.en: aware of whatever you do!
text.ar: یَعۡلَمُونَ مَا تَفۡعَلُونَ

text.en: Behold, [in the life to come] the truly virtuous: will indeed be in bliss,
text.ar: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ لَفِی نَعِیمࣲ

text.en: whereas, behold, the wicked will indeed be in a blazing fire –
text.ar: وَإِنَّ ٱلۡفُجَّارَ لَفِی جَحِیمࣲ

text.en: [a fire] which they shall enter on Judgment Day,
text.ar: یَصۡلَوۡنَهَا یَوۡمَ ٱلدِّینِ

text.en: and which they shall not [be able to] evade.
text.ar: وَمَا هُمۡ عَنۡهَا بِغَاۤىِٕبِینَ

text.en: And what could make thee conceive what that Judgment Day will be?
text.ar: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا یَوۡمُ ٱلدِّینِ

text.en: And once again: What could make thee conceive what that Judgment Day will be?
text.ar: ثُمَّ مَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا یَوۡمُ ٱلدِّینِ

text.en: [It will be] a Day when no human being shall be of the least avail to another human being: for on that Day [it will become manifest that] all sovereignty is God's alone.
text.ar: یَوۡمَ لَا تَمۡلِكُ نَفۡسࣱ لِّنَفۡسࣲ شَیۡـࣰٔاۖ وَٱلۡأَمۡرُ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلَّهِ

text.en: WOE UNTO THOSE who give short measure:
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ وَیۡلࣱ لِّلۡمُطَفِّفِینَ

text.en: those who, when they are to receive their due from [other] people, demand that it be given in full –
text.ar: ٱلَّذِینَ إِذَا ٱكۡتَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ یَسۡتَوۡفُونَ

text.en: but when they have to measure or weigh whatever they owe to others, give less than what is due!
text.ar: وَإِذَا كَالُوهُمۡ أَو وَّزَنُوهُمۡ یُخۡسِرُونَ

text.en: Do they not know that they are bound to be raised from the dead
text.ar: أَلَا یَظُنُّ أُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ أَنَّهُم مَّبۡعُوثُونَ

text.en: [and called to account] on an awesome Day –
text.ar: لِیَوۡمٍ عَظِیمࣲ

text.en: the Day when all men shall stand before the Sustainer of all the worlds?
text.ar: یَوۡمَ یَقُومُ ٱلنَّاسُ لِرَبِّ ٱلۡعَـٰلَمِینَ

text.en: NAY, VERILY, the record of the wicked is indeed [set down] in a mode inescapable!
text.ar: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلۡفُجَّارِ لَفِی سِجِّینࣲ

text.en: And what could make thee conceive what that that mode inescapable will be?
text.ar: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا سِجِّینࣱ

text.en: A record [indelibly] inscribed!
text.ar: كِتَـٰبࣱ مَّرۡقُومࣱ

text.en: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth –
text.ar: وَیۡلࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِینَ

text.en: those who give the lie to the [coming of] Judgment Day:
text.ar: ٱلَّذِینَ یُكَذِّبُونَ بِیَوۡمِ ٱلدِّینِ

text.en: for, none gives the lie to it but such as are wont to transgress against all that is [and are] immersed in sin:
text.ar: وَمَا یُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦۤ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعۡتَدٍ أَثِیمٍ

text.en: [and so,] whenever Our messages are conveyed to them, they but say, "Fables of ancient times!"
text.ar: إِذَا تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَیۡهِ ءَایَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِیرُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِینَ

text.en: Nay, but their hearts are corroded by all [the evil] that they were wont to do!
text.ar: كَلَّاۖ بَلۡۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ یَكۡسِبُونَ

text.en: Nay, verily, from [the grace of] their Sustainer shall they on that Day be debarred;
text.ar: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّهُمۡ عَن رَّبِّهِمۡ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لَّمَحۡجُوبُونَ

text.en: and then, behold, they shall enter the blazing fire
text.ar: ثُمَّ إِنَّهُمۡ لَصَالُوا۟ ٱلۡجَحِیمِ

text.en: and be told: "This is the [very thing] to which you were wont to give the lie!"
text.ar: ثُمَّ یُقَالُ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِی كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ

text.en: NAY, VERILY - the record of the truly virtuous is [set down] in a mode most lofty!
text.ar: كَلَّاۤ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارِ لَفِی عِلِّیِّینَ

text.en: And what could make thee conceive what that mode most lofty will be?
text.ar: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا عِلِّیُّونَ

text.en: A record [indelibly] inscribed,
text.ar: كِتَـٰبࣱ مَّرۡقُومࣱ

text.en: witnessed~ by all who have [ever] been drawn close unto God.
text.ar: یَشۡهَدُهُ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ

text.en: Behold, [in the life to come] the truly virtuous will indeed be in bliss:
text.ar: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ لَفِی نَعِیمٍ

text.en: [resting on couches, they will look up [to God]:
text.ar: عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَاۤىِٕكِ یَنظُرُونَ

text.en: upon their faces thou wilt see the brightness of bliss.
text.ar: تَعۡرِفُ فِی وُجُوهِهِمۡ نَضۡرَةَ ٱلنَّعِیمِ

text.en: They will be given a drink of pure wine whereon the seal [of God] will have been set,
text.ar: یُسۡقَوۡنَ مِن رَّحِیقࣲ مَّخۡتُومٍ

text.en: pouring forth with a fragrance of musk. To that [wine of paradise], then, let all such aspire as [are willing to] aspire to things of high account:
text.ar: خِتَـٰمُهُۥ مِسۡكࣱۚ وَفِی ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ فَلۡیَتَنَافَسِ ٱلۡمُتَنَـٰفِسُونَ

text.en: for it is composed of all that is most exalting
text.ar: وَمِزَاجُهُۥ مِن تَسۡنِیمٍ

text.en: a source [of bliss] whereof those who are drawn close unto God shall drink.
text.ar: عَیۡنࣰا یَشۡرَبُ بِهَا ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ

text.en: BEHOLD, those who have abandoned themselves to sin are wont to laugh at such as have attained to faith
text.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِینَ أَجۡرَمُوا۟ كَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ یَضۡحَكُونَ

text.en: and whenever they pass by them, they wink at one another [derisively];
text.ar: وَإِذَا مَرُّوا۟ بِهِمۡ یَتَغَامَزُونَ

text.en: and whenever they return to people of their own kind, they return full of jests;
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوۤا۟ إِلَىٰۤ أَهۡلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُوا۟ فَكِهِینَ

text.en: and whenever they see those [who believe,] they say, "Behold, these [people] have indeed gone astray!"
text.ar: وَإِذَا رَأَوۡهُمۡ قَالُوۤا۟ إِنَّ هَـٰۤؤُلَاۤءِ لَضَاۤلُّونَ

text.en: And, withal, they have no call to watch over [the beliefs of] others...
text.ar: وَمَاۤ أُرۡسِلُوا۟ عَلَیۡهِمۡ حَـٰفِظِینَ

text.en: But on the Day [of Judgment], they who had attained to faith will [be able to] laugh at the [erstwhile] deniers of the truth:
text.ar: فَٱلۡیَوۡمَ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلۡكُفَّارِ یَضۡحَكُونَ

text.en: [for, resting in paradise] on couches, they will look on [and say to themselves]:
text.ar: عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَاۤىِٕكِ یَنظُرُونَ

text.en: "Are these deniers of the truth being [thus] requited for [aught but] what they were wont to do?"
text.ar: هَلۡ ثُوِّبَ ٱلۡكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا۟ یَفۡعَلُونَ

text.en: WHEN THE SKY is split asunder,
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ إِذَا ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ ٱنشَقَّتۡ

text.en: obeying its Sustainer, as in truth it must;
text.ar: وَأَذِنَتۡ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتۡ

text.en: and when the earth is leveled,
text.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلۡأَرۡضُ مُدَّتۡ

text.en: and casts forth whatever is in it, and becomes utterly void,
text.ar: وَأَلۡقَتۡ مَا فِیهَا وَتَخَلَّتۡ

text.en: obeying its Sustainer, as in truth it must -:
text.ar: وَأَذِنَتۡ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتۡ

text.en: [then,] O man - thou [that] hast, verily, been toiling towards thy Sustainer in painful toil - then shalt thou meet Him!
text.ar: یَـٰۤأَیُّهَا ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدۡحࣰا فَمُلَـٰقِیهِ

text.en: And as for him whose record shall be placed in his right hand,
text.ar: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِیَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِیَمِینِهِۦ

text.en: he will in time be called to account with an easy accounting,
text.ar: فَسَوۡفَ یُحَاسَبُ حِسَابࣰا یَسِیرࣰا

text.en: and will [be able to] turn joyfully to those of his own kind.
text.ar: وَیَنقَلِبُ إِلَىٰۤ أَهۡلِهِۦ مَسۡرُورࣰا

text.en: But as for him whose record shall be given to him behind his back;
text.ar: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِیَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ وَرَاۤءَ ظَهۡرِهِۦ

text.en: he will in time pray for utter destruction:
text.ar: فَسَوۡفَ یَدۡعُوا۟ ثُبُورࣰا

text.en: but he will enter the blazing flame.
text.ar: وَیَصۡلَىٰ سَعِیرًا

text.en: Behold, [in his earthly life] he lived joyfully among people of his own kind
text.ar: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ فِیۤ أَهۡلِهِۦ مَسۡرُورًا

text.en: for, behold, he never thought that he would have to return [to God].
text.ar: إِنَّهُۥ ظَنَّ أَن لَّن یَحُورَ

text.en: Yea indeed! His Sustainer did see all that was in him!
text.ar: بَلَىٰۤۚ إِنَّ رَبَّهُۥ كَانَ بِهِۦ بَصِیرࣰا

text.en: BUT NAY! I call to witness the sunset's [fleeting] afterglow,
text.ar: فَلَاۤ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلشَّفَقِ

text.en: and the night, and what it [step by step] unfolds,
text.ar: وَٱلَّیۡلِ وَمَا وَسَقَ

text.en: and the moon, as it grows to its fullness:
text.ar: وَٱلۡقَمَرِ إِذَا ٱتَّسَقَ

text.en: [even thus, O men,] are you bound to move; onward from stage to stage.
text.ar: لَتَرۡكَبُنَّ طَبَقًا عَن طَبَقࣲ

text.en: What, then, is amiss with them that they will not believe [in a life to come]?
text.ar: فَمَا لَهُمۡ لَا یُؤۡمِنُونَ

text.en: and [that], when the Qur’an is read unto them, they do not fall down in prostration?
text.ar: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَیۡهِمُ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانُ لَا یَسۡجُدُونَ ۩

text.en: Nay, but they who are bent on denying the truth give the lie [to this divine writ]!
text.ar: بَلِ ٱلَّذِینَ كَفَرُوا۟ یُكَذِّبُونَ

text.en: Yet God has full knowledge of what they conceal [in their hearts].
text.ar: وَٱللَّهُ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَا یُوعُونَ

text.en: Hence, give them the tiding of grievous suffering [in the life to come] –
text.ar: فَبَشِّرۡهُم بِعَذَابٍ أَلِیمٍ

text.en: unless it be such [of them] as [repent, and] attain to faith, and do good works: for theirs shall be a reward unending!.
text.ar: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَیۡرُ مَمۡنُونِۭ

text.en: CONSIDER the sky full of great constellations,
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ وَٱلسَّمَاۤءِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡبُرُوجِ

text.en: and [then bethink thyself of] the promised Day,
text.ar: وَٱلۡیَوۡمِ ٱلۡمَوۡعُودِ

text.en: and [of] Him who witnesses [all], and [of] that unto which witness is borne [by Him]!
text.ar: وَشَاهِدࣲ وَمَشۡهُودࣲ

text.en: THEY DESTROY [but] themselves, they who would ready a pit
text.ar: قُتِلَ أَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلۡأُخۡدُودِ

text.en: of fire fiercely burning [for all who have attained to faith]!
text.ar: ٱلنَّارِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡوَقُودِ

text.en: Lo! [With glee do] they contemplate that [fire],
text.ar: إِذۡ هُمۡ عَلَیۡهَا قُعُودࣱ

text.en: fully conscious of what they are doing to the believers,
text.ar: وَهُمۡ عَلَىٰ مَا یَفۡعَلُونَ بِٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِینَ شُهُودࣱ

text.en: whom they hate for no other reason than that they believe in God, the Almighty, the One to whom all praise is due,
text.ar: وَمَا نَقَمُوا۟ مِنۡهُمۡ إِلَّاۤ أَن یُؤۡمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَزِیزِ ٱلۡحَمِیدِ

text.en: [and] to whom the dominion of the heavens and the earth belongs. But God is witness unto everything!
text.ar: ٱلَّذِی لَهُۥ مُلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَیۡءࣲ شَهِیدٌ

text.en: Verily, as for those who persecute believing men and believing women, and thereafter do not repent, hell's suffering awaits them: yea, suffering through fire awaits them!
text.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِینَ فَتَنُوا۟ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِینَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَـٰتِ ثُمَّ لَمۡ یَتُوبُوا۟ فَلَهُمۡ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابُ ٱلۡحَرِیقِ

text.en: [But,] verily, they who attain to faith and do righteous deeds shall [in the life to come] have gardens through which running waters flow - that triumph most great!
text.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَهُمۡ جَنَّـٰتࣱ تَجۡرِی مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَـٰرُۚ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ ٱلۡفَوۡزُ ٱلۡكَبِیرُ

text.en: VERILY, thy Sustainer's grip is exceedingly strong!
text.ar: إِنَّ بَطۡشَ رَبِّكَ لَشَدِیدٌ

text.en: Behold, it is He who creates [man] in the first instance, and He [it is who] will bring him forth anew.
text.ar: إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ یُبۡدِئُ وَیُعِیدُ

text.en: And He alone is truly-forgiving, all-embracing in His love,
text.ar: وَهُوَ ٱلۡغَفُورُ ٱلۡوَدُودُ

text.en: in sublime almightiness enthroned,
text.ar: ذُو ٱلۡعَرۡشِ ٱلۡمَجِیدُ

text.en: a sovereign doer of whatever He wills.
text.ar: فَعَّالࣱ لِّمَا یُرِیدُ

text.en: HAS IT ever come within thy ken, the story of the [sinful] hosts
text.ar: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِیثُ ٱلۡجُنُودِ

text.en: of Pharaoh, and of [the tribe of] Thamud?
text.ar: فِرۡعَوۡنَ وَثَمُودَ

text.en: And yet, they who are bent on denying the truth persist in giving it the lie:
text.ar: بَلِ ٱلَّذِینَ كَفَرُوا۟ فِی تَكۡذِیبࣲ

text.en: but all the while God encompasses them [with His knowledge and might] without their being aware of it.
text.ar: وَٱللَّهُ مِن وَرَاۤىِٕهِم مُّحِیطُۢ

text.en: Nay, but this [divine writ which they reject] is a discourse sublime,
text.ar: بَلۡ هُوَ قُرۡءَانࣱ مَّجِیدࣱ

text.en: upon an imperishable tablet [inscribed].
text.ar: فِی لَوۡحࣲ مَّحۡفُوظِۭ

text.en: CONSIDER the heavens and that which comes in the night!
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ وَٱلسَّمَاۤءِ وَٱلطَّارِقِ

text.en: And what could make thee conceive what it is that comes in the night?
text.ar: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلطَّارِقُ

text.en: It is the star that pierces through [life's] darkness:
text.ar: ٱلنَّجۡمُ ٱلثَّاقِبُ

text.en: [for] no human being has ever been left unguarded.
text.ar: إِن كُلُّ نَفۡسࣲ لَّمَّا عَلَیۡهَا حَافِظࣱ

text.en: LET MAN, then, observe out of what he has been created:
text.ar: فَلۡیَنظُرِ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ مِمَّ خُلِقَ

text.en: he has been created out of a seminal fluid
text.ar: خُلِقَ مِن مَّاۤءࣲ دَافِقࣲ

text.en: issuing from between the loins [of man] and the pelvic arch [of woman].
text.ar: یَخۡرُجُ مِنۢ بَیۡنِ ٱلصُّلۡبِ وَٱلتَّرَاۤىِٕبِ

text.en: Now, verily, He [who thus creates man in the first instance] is well able to bring him back [to life]
text.ar: إِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ رَجۡعِهِۦ لَقَادِرࣱ

text.en: on the Day when all secrets will be laid bare,
text.ar: یَوۡمَ تُبۡلَى ٱلسَّرَاۤىِٕرُ

text.en: and [man] will have neither strength nor helper!
text.ar: فَمَا لَهُۥ مِن قُوَّةࣲ وَلَا نَاصِرࣲ

text.en: Consider the heavens, ever-revolving,
text.ar: وَٱلسَّمَاۤءِ ذَاتِ ٱلرَّجۡعِ

text.en: and the earth, bursting forth with plants!
text.ar: وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ ذَاتِ ٱلصَّدۡعِ

text.en: BEHOLD, this [divine writ] is indeed a word that between truth and falsehood,
text.ar: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوۡلࣱ فَصۡلࣱ

text.en: and is no idle tale.
text.ar: وَمَا هُوَ بِٱلۡهَزۡلِ

text.en: Behold, they [who refuse to accept it] devise many a false argument [to disprove its truth];
text.ar: إِنَّهُمۡ یَكِیدُونَ كَیۡدࣰا

text.en: but I shall bring all their scheming to nought.
text.ar: وَأَكِیدُ كَیۡدࣰا

text.en: Let, then, the deniers of the truth have their will: let them have their will for a little while.
text.ar: فَمَهِّلِ ٱلۡكَـٰفِرِینَ أَمۡهِلۡهُمۡ رُوَیۡدَۢا

text.en: EXTOL the limitless glory of thy Sustainer's name: [the glory of] the Al-Highest,
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ سَبِّحِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡأَعۡلَى

text.en: who creates [every thing], and thereupon forms it in accordance with what it is meant to be,
text.ar: ٱلَّذِی خَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ

text.en: and who determines the nature [of all that exists], and thereupon guides it [towards its fulfilment],
text.ar: وَٱلَّذِی قَدَّرَ فَهَدَىٰ

text.en: and who brings forth herbage,
text.ar: وَٱلَّذِیۤ أَخۡرَجَ ٱلۡمَرۡعَىٰ

text.en: and thereupon causes it to decay into rust-brown stubble!
text.ar: فَجَعَلَهُۥ غُثَاۤءً أَحۡوَىٰ

text.en: WE SHALL teach thee, and thou wilt not forget [aught of what thou art taught],
text.ar: سَنُقۡرِئُكَ فَلَا تَنسَىٰۤ

text.en: save what God may will [thee to forget] - for, verily, He [alone] knows all that is open to [man's] perception as well as all that is hidden [from it]
text.ar: إِلَّا مَا شَاۤءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّهُۥ یَعۡلَمُ ٱلۡجَهۡرَ وَمَا یَخۡفَىٰ

text.en: and [thus] shall We make easy for thee the path towards [ultimate] ease.
text.ar: وَنُیَسِّرُكَ لِلۡیُسۡرَىٰ

text.en: REMIND, THEN, [others of the truth, regardless of] whether this reminding [would seem to] be of use [or not]:
text.ar: فَذَكِّرۡ إِن نَّفَعَتِ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ

text.en: in mind will keep it he who stands in awe [of God],
text.ar: سَیَذَّكَّرُ مَن یَخۡشَىٰ

text.en: but aloof from it will remain that most hapless wretch –
text.ar: وَیَتَجَنَّبُهَا ٱلۡأَشۡقَى

text.en: he who [in the life to come] shall have to endure the great fire
text.ar: ٱلَّذِی یَصۡلَى ٱلنَّارَ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ

text.en: wherein he will neither die nor remain alive.
text.ar: ثُمَّ لَا یَمُوتُ فِیهَا وَلَا یَحۡیَىٰ

text.en: To happiness [in the life to come] will indeed attain he who attains to purity [in this world],
text.ar: قَدۡ أَفۡلَحَ مَن تَزَكَّىٰ

text.en: and remembers his Sustainer's name, and prays [unto Him].
text.ar: وَذَكَرَ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّهِۦ فَصَلَّىٰ

text.en: But nay, [O men,] you prefer the life of this world,
text.ar: بَلۡ تُؤۡثِرُونَ ٱلۡحَیَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡیَا

text.en: although the life to come is better and more enduring.
text.ar: وَٱلۡـَٔاخِرَةُ خَیۡرࣱ وَأَبۡقَىٰۤ

text.en: Verily, [all] this has indeed been [said] in the earlier revelations –
text.ar: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَفِی ٱلصُّحُفِ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ

text.en: the revelations of Abraham and Moses.
text.ar: صُحُفِ إِبۡرَ ٰ⁠هِیمَ وَمُوسَىٰ

text.en: HAS THERE COME unto thee the tiding of the Overshadowing Event?'
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِیثُ ٱلۡغَـٰشِیَةِ

text.en: Some faces will on that Day be downcast,
text.ar: وُجُوهࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذٍ خَـٰشِعَةٌ

text.en: toiling [under burdens of sin], worn out [by fear],
text.ar: عَامِلَةࣱ نَّاصِبَةࣱ

text.en: about to enter a glowing fire,
text.ar: تَصۡلَىٰ نَارًا حَامِیَةࣰ

text.en: given to drink from a boiling spring.
text.ar: تُسۡقَىٰ مِنۡ عَیۡنٍ ءَانِیَةࣲ

text.en: No food for them save the bitterness of dry thorns,
text.ar: لَّیۡسَ لَهُمۡ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِیعࣲ

text.en: which gives no strength and neither stills hunger.
text.ar: لَّا یُسۡمِنُ وَلَا یُغۡنِی مِن جُوعࣲ

text.en: [And] some faces will on that Day shine with bliss,
text.ar: وُجُوهࣱ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ نَّاعِمَةࣱ

text.en: well-pleased with [the fruit of] their striving,
text.ar: لِّسَعۡیِهَا رَاضِیَةࣱ

text.en: in a garden sublime,
text.ar: فِی جَنَّةٍ عَالِیَةࣲ

text.en: wherein thou wilt hear no empty talk.
text.ar: لَّا تَسۡمَعُ فِیهَا لَـٰغِیَةࣰ

text.en: Countless springs will flow therein,
text.ar: فِیهَا عَیۡنࣱ جَارِیَةࣱ

text.en: [and] there will be thrones [of happiness] raised high,
text.ar: فِیهَا سُرُرࣱ مَّرۡفُوعَةࣱ

text.en: and goblets placed ready,
text.ar: وَأَكۡوَابࣱ مَّوۡضُوعَةࣱ

text.en: and cushions ranged,
text.ar: وَنَمَارِقُ مَصۡفُوفَةࣱ

text.en: and carpets spread out…
text.ar: وَزَرَابِیُّ مَبۡثُوثَةٌ

text.en: DO, THEN, they [who deny resurrection] never gaze at the clouds pregnant with water, [and observe] how they are created?
text.ar: أَفَلَا یَنظُرُونَ إِلَى ٱلۡإِبِلِ كَیۡفَ خُلِقَتۡ

text.en: And at the sky, how it is raised aloft?
text.ar: وَإِلَى ٱلسَّمَاۤءِ كَیۡفَ رُفِعَتۡ

text.en: And at the mountains, how firmly they are reared?
text.ar: وَإِلَى ٱلۡجِبَالِ كَیۡفَ نُصِبَتۡ

text.en: And at the earth, how it is spread out?
text.ar: وَإِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ كَیۡفَ سُطِحَتۡ

text.en: And so, [O Prophet,] exhort them; thy task is only to exhort:
text.ar: فَذَكِّرۡ إِنَّمَاۤ أَنتَ مُذَكِّرࣱ

text.en: thou canst not compel them [to believe].
text.ar: لَّسۡتَ عَلَیۡهِم بِمُصَیۡطِرٍ

text.en: However, as for him who turns away, being bent on denying the truth,
text.ar: إِلَّا مَن تَوَلَّىٰ وَكَفَرَ

text.en: him will God cause to suffer the greatest suffering [in the life to come]:
text.ar: فَیُعَذِّبُهُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَكۡبَرَ

text.en: for behold, unto Us will be their return,
text.ar: إِنَّ إِلَیۡنَاۤ إِیَابَهُمۡ

text.en: and verily, It is for Us to call them to account.
text.ar: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَیۡنَا حِسَابَهُم

text.en: CONSIDER the daybreak
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ وَٱلۡفَجۡرِ

text.en: and the ten nights!
text.ar: وَلَیَالٍ عَشۡرࣲ

text.en: Consider the multiple and the One!
text.ar: وَٱلشَّفۡعِ وَٱلۡوَتۡرِ

text.en: Consider the night as it runs its course!
text.ar: وَٱلَّیۡلِ إِذَا یَسۡرِ

text.en: Considering all this - could there be, to anyone endowed with reason, a [more] solemn evidence of the truth?
text.ar: هَلۡ فِی ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ قَسَمࣱ لِّذِی حِجۡرٍ

text.en: ART THOU NOT aware of how thy Sustainer has dealt with [the tribe of] ‘Ad,
text.ar: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَیۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ

text.en: [the people of] Iram the many-pillared,
text.ar: إِرَمَ ذَاتِ ٱلۡعِمَادِ

text.en: the like of whom has never been reared in all the land? –
text.ar: ٱلَّتِی لَمۡ یُخۡلَقۡ مِثۡلُهَا فِی ٱلۡبِلَـٰدِ

text.en: and with [the tribe of] Thamud, who hollowed out rocks in the valley? –
text.ar: وَثَمُودَ ٱلَّذِینَ جَابُوا۟ ٱلصَّخۡرَ بِٱلۡوَادِ

text.en: and with Pharaoh of the [many] tent-poles?
text.ar: وَفِرۡعَوۡنَ ذِی ٱلۡأَوۡتَادِ

text.en: [It was they] who transgressed all bounds of equity all over their lands,
text.ar: ٱلَّذِینَ طَغَوۡا۟ فِی ٱلۡبِلَـٰدِ

text.en: and brought about great corruption therein:
text.ar: فَأَكۡثَرُوا۟ فِیهَا ٱلۡفَسَادَ

text.en: and therefore thy Sustainer let loose upon them a scourge of suffering:
text.ar: فَصَبَّ عَلَیۡهِمۡ رَبُّكَ سَوۡطَ عَذَابٍ

text.en: for, verily, thy Sustainer is ever on the watch!
text.ar: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَبِٱلۡمِرۡصَادِ

text.en: BUT AS FOR man, whenever his Sustainer tries him by His generosity and by letting him enjoy a life of ease, he says, "My Sustainer has been [justly] generous towards me";
text.ar: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكۡرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَیَقُولُ رَبِّیۤ أَكۡرَمَنِ

text.en: whereas, whenever He tries him by straitening his means of livelihood, he says, "My Sustainer has disgraced me!"
text.ar: وَأَمَّاۤ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَیۡهِ رِزۡقَهُۥ فَیَقُولُ رَبِّیۤ أَهَـٰنَنِ

text.en: But nay, nay, [O men, consider all that you do and fail to do:] you are not generous towards the orphan,
text.ar: كَلَّاۖ بَل لَّا تُكۡرِمُونَ ٱلۡیَتِیمَ

text.en: and you do not urge one another to feed the needy,
text.ar: وَلَا تَحَـٰۤضُّونَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلۡمِسۡكِینِ

text.en: and you devour the inheritance [of others] with devouring greed,
text.ar: وَتَأۡكُلُونَ ٱلتُّرَاثَ أَكۡلࣰا لَّمࣰّا

text.en: and you love wealth with boundless love!
text.ar: وَتُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡمَالَ حُبࣰّا جَمࣰّا

text.en: Nay, but [how will you fare on Judgment Day,] when the earth is crushed with crushing upon crushing,
text.ar: كَلَّاۤۖ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ دَكࣰّا دَكࣰّا

text.en: and [the majesty of] thy Sustainer stands revealed, as well as [the true nature of] the angels; rank upon rank?
text.ar: وَجَاۤءَ رَبُّكَ وَٱلۡمَلَكُ صَفࣰّا صَفࣰّا

text.en: And on that Day hell will be brought [within sight]; on that Day man will remember [all that he did and failed to do]: but what will that remembrance avail him?
text.ar: وَجِا۟یۤءَ یَوۡمَىِٕذِۭ بِجَهَنَّمَۚ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ یَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ

text.en: He will say, "Oh, would that I had. provided beforehand for my life [to come]!"
text.ar: یَقُولُ یَـٰلَیۡتَنِی قَدَّمۡتُ لِحَیَاتِی

text.en: For, none can make suffer as He will make suffer [the sinners] on that Day,
text.ar: فَیَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لَّا یُعَذِّبُ عَذَابَهُۥۤ أَحَدࣱ

text.en: and none can bind with bonds like His.
text.ar: وَلَا یُوثِقُ وَثَاقَهُۥۤ أَحَدࣱ

text.en: [But unto the righteous God will say,] "O thou human being that hast attained to inner peace!
text.ar: یَـٰۤأَیَّتُهَا ٱلنَّفۡسُ ٱلۡمُطۡمَىِٕنَّةُ

text.en: Return thou unto thy Sustainer, well-pleased [and] pleasing [Him]:
text.ar: ٱرۡجِعِیۤ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكِ رَاضِیَةࣰ مَّرۡضِیَّةࣰ

text.en: enter, then, together with My [other true] servants –
text.ar: فَٱدۡخُلِی فِی عِبَـٰدِی

text.en: yea, enter thou My paradise!"
text.ar: وَٱدۡخُلِی جَنَّتِی

text.en: NAY! I call to witness this land –
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ لَاۤ أُقۡسِمُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ

text.en: this land in which thou art free to dwell -
text.ar: وَأَنتَ حِلُّۢ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ

text.en: and [I call to witness] parent and offspring:
text.ar: وَوَالِدࣲ وَمَا وَلَدَ

text.en: Verily, We have created man into [a life of] pain, toil and trial.
text.ar: لَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنَ فِی كَبَدٍ

text.en: Does he, then, think that no one has power over him?
text.ar: أَیَحۡسَبُ أَن لَّن یَقۡدِرَ عَلَیۡهِ أَحَدࣱ

text.en: He boasts, "I have spent wealth abundant!"
text.ar: یَقُولُ أَهۡلَكۡتُ مَالࣰا لُّبَدًا

text.en: Does he, then, think that no one sees him?
text.ar: أَیَحۡسَبُ أَن لَّمۡ یَرَهُۥۤ أَحَدٌ

text.en: Have We not given him two eyes,
text.ar: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَل لَّهُۥ عَیۡنَیۡنِ

text.en: and a tongue, and a pair of lips,
text.ar: وَلِسَانࣰا وَشَفَتَیۡنِ

text.en: and shown him the two highways [of good and evil]?
text.ar: وَهَدَیۡنَـٰهُ ٱلنَّجۡدَیۡنِ

text.en: But he would not try to ascend the steep uphill road...
text.ar: فَلَا ٱقۡتَحَمَ ٱلۡعَقَبَةَ

text.en: And what could make thee conceive what it is, that steep uphill road?
text.ar: وَمَاۤ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡعَقَبَةُ

text.en: [It is] the freeing of one's neck [from the burden of sin],
text.ar: فَكُّ رَقَبَةٍ

text.en: or the feeding, upon a day of [one's own] hunger,
text.ar: أَوۡ إِطۡعَـٰمࣱ فِی یَوۡمࣲ ذِی مَسۡغَبَةࣲ

text.en: of an orphan near of kin,
text.ar: یَتِیمࣰا ذَا مَقۡرَبَةٍ

text.en: or of a needy [stranger] lying in the dust –
text.ar: أَوۡ مِسۡكِینࣰا ذَا مَتۡرَبَةࣲ

text.en: and being, withal, of those who have attained to faith, and who enjoin upon one another patience in adversity, and enjoin upon one another compassion.
text.ar: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِینَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَتَوَاصَوۡا۟ بِٱلصَّبۡرِ وَتَوَاصَوۡا۟ بِٱلۡمَرۡحَمَةِ

text.en: Such are they that have attained to righteousness;
text.ar: أُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ أَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلۡمَیۡمَنَةِ

text.en: whereas those who are bent on denying the truth of Our messages – they are such as have lost themselves in evil,
text.ar: وَٱلَّذِینَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔایَـٰتِنَا هُمۡ أَصۡحَـٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ

text.en: [with] fire closing in upon them.
text.ar: عَلَیۡهِمۡ نَارࣱ مُّؤۡصَدَةُۢ

text.en: CONSIDER the sun and its radiant brightness,
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ وَٱلشَّمۡسِ وَضُحَىٰهَا

text.en: and the moon as it reflects the sun!
text.ar: وَٱلۡقَمَرِ إِذَا تَلَىٰهَا

text.en: Consider the day as it reveals the world,
text.ar: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا جَلَّىٰهَا

text.en: and the night as it veils it darkly!
text.ar: وَٱلَّیۡلِ إِذَا یَغۡشَىٰهَا

text.en: Consider the sky and its wondrous make,
text.ar: وَٱلسَّمَاۤءِ وَمَا بَنَىٰهَا

text.en: and the earth and all its expanse!
text.ar: وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا طَحَىٰهَا

text.en: Consider the human self, and how it is formed in accordance with what it is meant to be,
text.ar: وَنَفۡسࣲ وَمَا سَوَّىٰهَا

text.en: and how it is imbued with moral failings as well as with consciousness of God!
text.ar: فَأَلۡهَمَهَا فُجُورَهَا وَتَقۡوَىٰهَا

text.en: To a happy state shall indeed attain he who causes this [self] to grow in purity,
text.ar: قَدۡ أَفۡلَحَ مَن زَكَّىٰهَا

text.en: and truly lost is he who buries it [in darkness].
text.ar: وَقَدۡ خَابَ مَن دَسَّىٰهَا

text.en: TO [THIS] TRUTH gave the lie, in their overweening arrogance, [the tribe of] Thamud,
text.ar: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ بِطَغۡوَىٰهَاۤ

text.en: when that most hapless wretch from among them rushed forward [to commit his evil deed],
text.ar: إِذِ ٱنۢبَعَثَ أَشۡقَىٰهَا

text.en: although God's apostle had told them, "It is a she-camel belonging to God, so let her drink [and do her no harm]!"
text.ar: فَقَالَ لَهُمۡ رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ نَاقَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَسُقۡیَـٰهَا

text.en: But they gave him the lie, and cruelly slaughtered her - whereupon their Sustainer visited them with utter destruction for this their sin, destroying them all alike:
text.ar: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمۡدَمَ عَلَیۡهِمۡ رَبُّهُم بِذَنۢبِهِمۡ فَسَوَّىٰهَا

text.en: for none [of them] had any fear of what might befall them.
text.ar: وَلَا یَخَافُ عُقۡبَـٰهَا

text.en: CONSIDER the night as it veils [the earth] in darkness,
text.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ وَٱلَّیۡلِ إِذَا یَغۡشَىٰ

text.en: and the day as it rises bright!
text.ar: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا تَجَلَّىٰ

text.en: Consider the creation of the male and the female!
text.ar: وَمَا خَلَقَ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰۤ

text.en: Verily, [O men,] you aim at most divergent ends!
text.ar: إِنَّ سَعۡیَكُمۡ لَشَتَّىٰ

text.en: Thus, as for him who gives [to others] and is conscious of God,
text.ar: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أَعۡطَىٰ وَٱتَّقَىٰ

text.en: and believes in the truth of the ultimate good
text.ar: وَصَدَّقَ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰ

text.en: for him shall We make easy the path towards [ultimate] ease.
text.ar: فَسَنُیَسِّرُهُۥ لِلۡیُسۡرَىٰ

text.en: But as for him who is niggardly, and thinks that he is self-sufficient,
text.ar: وَأَمَّا مَنۢ بَخِلَ وَٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰ

text.en: and calls the ultimate good a lie –
text.ar: وَكَذَّبَ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰ

text.en: for him shall We make easy the path towards hardship:
text.ar: فَسَنُیَسِّرُهُۥ لِلۡعُسۡرَىٰ

text.en: and what will his wealth avail him when he goes down [to his grave]?
text.ar: وَمَا یُغۡنِی عَنۡهُ مَالُهُۥۤ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰۤ

text.en: BEHOLD, it is indeed for Us to grace [you] with guidance;
text.ar: إِنَّ عَلَیۡنَا لَلۡهُدَىٰ

text.en: and, behold, Ours is [the dominion over] the life to come as well as [over] this earlier part [of your life]:
text.ar: وَإِنَّ لَنَا لَلۡـَٔاخِرَةَ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰ

text.en: and so I warn you of the raging fire -
text.ar: فَأَنذَرۡتُكُمۡ نَارࣰا تَلَظَّىٰ

text.en: [the fire] which none shall have to endure but that most hapless wretch
text.ar: لَا یَصۡلَىٰهَاۤ إِلَّا ٱلۡأَشۡقَى

text.en: who gives the lie to the truth and turns away [from it].
text.ar: ٱلَّذِی كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

text.en: For, distant from it shall remain he who is truly conscious of God:
text.ar: وَسَیُجَنَّبُهَا ٱلۡأَتۡقَى

text.en: he that spends his possessions [on others] so that he might grow in purity –
text.ar: ٱلَّذِی یُؤۡتِی مَالَهُۥ یَتَزَكَّىٰ

text.en: not as payment for favours received,
text.ar: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِندَهُۥ مِن نِّعۡمَةࣲ تُجۡزَىٰۤ

text.en: but only out of a longing for the countenance of his Sustainer, the All-Highest:
text.ar: إِلَّا ٱبۡتِغَاۤءَ وَجۡهِ رَبِّهِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ

text.en: and such, indeed, shall in time be well-pleased.
text.ar: وَلَسَوۡفَ یَرۡضَىٰ

text.en: CONSIDER the bright morning hours,
